articles.title: The Secret Payments That Keep Global Ransomware Attacks Going
articles.author: Chris Summers
articles.summary: 'Ransoms are being paid left, right and center,' one tech expert said. AI is being deployed to help the attackers find their targets more quickly, according to experts. Ransomware is a type of malicious software that prevents a user from accessing their computer files, systems, or networks and demands a ransom for their return.

It's expected to be a breakthrough in the field of AI.

articles.summary: Andrew Tulloch turned down a billion-dollar offer from Mark Zuckerberg's Meta. He was offered a six-year pay package spread over US$1.55 billion, but he turned it down. He worked at Facebook's AI company for 11 years before joining OpenAI. He co-founded AI start-up Thinking Machines Lab with Mira Murati this year.

articles.title: Google DeepMind CEO demonstrates Genie 2
articles.author: Will Croxton
articles.summary: This week, 60 Minutes correspondent Scott Pelley reported on advances in artificial intelligence technology led by Google DeepMind. articles.summary: Gen Zs are likeliest to think AI will improve the quality of life for humans.   iReport.com will let you know what Gen Zs think about AI and its potential benefits and drawbacks. iReport is on Facebook.com/genzs.

articles.author: Keithen Drury
articles.summary: Nvidia's growth rate could reaccelerate with its China export license expected to be restored. Taiwan Semiconductor and ASML are seeing increased chip demand. Alphabet recently reported impressive earnings with revenue rising 14% year over year and diluted earnings per share rising 22%. It trades for less than 20 times forward earnings and is cheaper than the S&P 500.

articles.title: Apple Developing In-House AI Assistant Rivaling Google's Search
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Apple is developing a ChatGPT-like AI assistant called 'Answers' which could be integrated into existing Apple services like Siri, Safari and others. The development of its own AI engine could provide Apple with greater control and adaptability. Apple may need to renegotiate its search deal with Google.

articles.author: Anthony Ha
articles.summary: Apple has formed a new team to build a ChatGPT-like app, according to Bloomberg's Mark Gurman. The team is looking for people with experience with search algorithms and engine development to join. Apple has already integrated chatGPT into Siri, but a more personalized, AI-powered update to the voice assistant has been repeatedly delayed.

articles.title: Is AI making us less intelligent? The debate over declining cognitive skills in the age of ChatGPT and smartphones
articles.author: Intelli News
articles.summary: By 2025, the average Briton will check their phone over 100 times a day. Smartphones are associated with declining attention spans and reduced memory. IQ scores in Norway have been falling since the 1970s, reversing decades of gains known as the 'Flynn Effect'.

articles.title: Is AI making us less intelligent? The debate over declining cognitive skills in the age of ChatGPT and smartphones
articles.author: Taipei Office

IQ scores in Norway have been falling since the 1970s. Teenagers in Asia struggle to complete tasks in school, especially those involving writing.

articles.title: Why tomorrow's best devs won't just code — they'll curate, coordinate and command AI
articles.author: Comply Control
articles.summary: As AI takes on more and more new competencies, junior coding is rapidly becoming a thing of the past. The most valuable people in tech will be those who know what should be built, why it matters and how to get an AI system to do most of the work cleanly and efficiently. People with creativity and a knack for problem-solving will have huge opportunities ahead.

articles.title: Why tomorrow's best devs won't just code — they'll curate, coordinate and command AI
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: As AI takes on more competencies, junior coding is rapidly becoming a thing of the past for entry-level developers. AI assistants like ChatGPT, GitHub Copilot and Amazon CodeWhisperer can do most junior-level tasks on their own. As a result, beginners entering the industry are asked to contribute at a level that used to require years of experience.

articles.summary: Nvidia is the clear winner in a head-to-head comparison of AI investment potential. BigBear.ai is an AI data analytics firm serving both corporate and government clients. Its stock has risen 323% over the past year, mirroring the gains of competitors like Palantir. However, the company is unprofitable and has a low growth rate. The report recommends Nvidia as the 'no-brainer' choice.

articles.title: Why the AI era is forcing a redesign of the entire compute backbone
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: The next computing revolution will demand a step-change in capabilities far exceeding the advancements of the internet era. The dominant trend in computing has been the democratization of compute through scale-out architectures built on nearly identical, commodity servers. The demands of gen AI, heavily reliant on predictable mathematical operations on massive datasets, are reversing this trend. The AI Impact Series returns to San Francisco on August 5.

articles.title: The AI-Powered Workplace: Reshaping How We Work
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming the modern workplace. It's not about replacing humans, but augmenting their capabilities and unlocking new levels of productivity and innovation. However, widespread adoption of AI isn't happening as quickly as the hype suggests. There are several barriers to its adoption, such as lack of trust and lack of organization readiness.

articles.title: Opinion: Artificial intelligence and the end of college education

articles.summary: Since ChatGPT appeared in 2022, AI is reshaping everything. Schools, both K-12 and higher ed, have rushed to embrace AI. Data governance and validation processes are paramount.

articles.title: Wall Street Outlook: AI, Earnings, and Tariff Uncertainty Dominate Week Ahead
articles.summary: Investors are increasingly convinced that AI will be a transformative force, reshaping numerous sectors of the global economy. The global AI market is projected to reach $1.84 trillion by 2030, according to Grand View Research. Ethical concerns, data privacy concerns, and the potential for job displacement are valid points of discussion, but the overall outlook for AI investment remains positive.

articles.title: How Generative AI Is Changing The Way We Work
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Generative AI is reshaping work. It boosts productivity, enhances creativity, and transforms how teams draft, analyze, and collaborate every day. It's transforming how people draft and analyze. It also improves creativity and improves teams' productivity. It can also enhance creativity and improve team work.

articles.summary: GROK 4 is a computerized entity that answers questions with human intelligence. GROK avoids copying and pasting the information and prefers to put all ideas through his human brain to create his own original content. He works hard to remain an ordinary human with no interest in or expertise in specialized technical fields.

articles.title: How Generative AI Is Changing The Way We Work
articles.author: Kathleen Walch
articles.summary: Generative AI has gone from a futuristic buzzword to something practical and powerful. Generative AI is already baked into how teams across industries get things done. It's helping draft proposals, untangle data, write code, analyze reports, and act as a collaboration partner to spark new ideas. People who know how to work with AI are outpacing those who don't.

articles.summary: Utah's economy has been shaped by forward-looking leadership and carefully crafted positive public policy. Utah has seen booming growth in technology, record job creation and a national reputation as one of the best places to build a business. Utah should be a place where emerging technologies are welcomed and given the freedom to thrive.

articles.title: Big Tech may be breaking the bank for AI, but investors love it
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: AI played a bigger role in driving demand across internet search, digital advertising and cloud computing in the April-June quarter, powering revenue growth at technology giants Microsoft, Meta and Alphabet. articles.author: David Coletto

articles.summary: Palantir Technologies stock has more than doubled this year and is up nearly 1,500% over the past three years. Its government and defense contracts give it stability and create a high barrier to entry. Its commercial platform in the U.S. is growing at a faster pace than the company's total revenue growth.

articles.summary: Chat GPT was used by North Carolina's treasurers' office in a three-month trial. It helps simplify complex documents into plain language and summarize long reports. A third of the participants had never used AI before, and 85% of them reported a positive experience.

articles.title: I spent a weekend testing this $3,500 robot pool cleaner. Is it worth the investment?
articles.author: Michelle Rae Uy
articles.summary: Beatbot AquaSense 2 Ultra Robotic Pool Cleaner costs $3,550. It's easy to set up, intuitive to use and packed with smart features. It has a battery life long enough to last a whole day of cleaning. The app is thoughtfully designed for an uncomplicated user experience.

articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.summary: Hunter Lightman joined OpenAI as a researcher in 2022. He worked on a team teaching AI models to solve high school math competitions. Today, he is instrumental to the development of AI agents that can do tasks on a computer like a human would. One of OpenAI's models recently won a gold medal at the International Math Olympiad. Mark Zuckerberg hired five of the o1 researchers to work on Meta's new superintelligence-focused unit.

articles.title: Inside OpenAI's quest to make AI do anything for you

articles.author: Tim Newcomb
articles.summary: The world's population passed 8 billion late last year. The global population is growing at its slowest rate since 1950. Two-thirds of the global population lives in a country or area where lifetime fertility is below 2.1 births per woman. The University of Washington study claims that by 2100, there won't be any more than 8.8 billion people on Earth.

articles.summary: Hertz uses artificial intelligence to scan for damage on cars and charge the customer for it. It's the latest example of a service industry application of AI. Hoteliers are also using AI to improve efficiency in their operations, but not quite in the same way as Hertz.

articles.summary: Shinkei Systems wants to bring a traditional Japanese method of handling fish to fine dining in the U.S. using technology to replace the labor-intensive process traditionally handled by practitioners on board ships. The company's AI-driven robot, Poseidon, has been designed to do a traditional form of fish handling called ikejime in Japanese.

articles.title: Delta Air Lines faces scrutiny over AI-powered pricing tool
articles.summary: Delta Air Lines is testing a new artificial intelligence system designed to optimize ticket prices. articles.title: Zuckerberg Says Meta Is Now Seeing Signs of Advanced AI Improving Itself
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is trying to gain a lead in the AI industry with his Meta AI lab. He claims to have seen "glimpses" of self-improving AI in recent months, but he didn't go into detail about them. The concept of AI that can improve itself without humans isn't defined.

It is also believed that the paid user base of ChatGPT has risen from 3 million a few months ago to 5 million now.

articles.author: Drew Harwell
articles.summary: Jeff Fargo's mother died two days ago and he used chatbot ChatGPT to write an obituary for her. Funeral directors are increasingly using AI to write the obituaries for their loved ones. Tech start-ups are working to build a range of AI-powered funeral home management software.

articles.title: Delta Gets Blowback for Using AI to Set Airfares
articles.author: Alison Sider
articles.summary: Delta has been working with Fetcherr, a startup that aims to transform airline pricing the way that algorithmic trading upended financial markets. Executives in July said they were pleased with the progress of testing and that the airline's new tool could help set up to 20% of its domestic fares by the end of the year. Now Delta is trying to calm a firestorm of objections from lawmakers and consumer advocates who fear airlines could use AI to reach into customers' browser histories or dig up other personal information to jack up fares. American Airlines CEO Robert Isom likened AI pricing tactics to a 'bait and switch' that tricks customers.

articles.title: Adrian Wooldridge: What if the US isn't the world's most innovative country?
articles.author: Adrian Wooldridge

articles.title: The Healing Power of Listening: Why Patient Interaction is Key to Better Medical Care
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Global powers are accelerating efforts to regulate artificial intelligence, which could reshape the landscape for major technology companies worldwide. Listening to patients is a cornerstone of superior medical care and improved patient outcomes. Empathetic communication activates the patient's prefrontal cortex, which is responsible for rational thought and emotional regulation. When patients feel heard and understood, they are more likely to actively participate in their care.

articles.title: I've been testing the iOS 26 public beta — what I like and what I don't about the Apple Intelligence additions

articles.title: 7 major AI updates this week — including one that could change search forever
articles.author: Amanda Caswell
articles.summary: This week, Google, Microsoft, OpenAI and Showrunner launched new AI features. Gemini's new mode called Deep Think gives it more 'thinking time' and allows it to brainstorm, refine and settle on a better response. Microsoft rolled out Copilot Mode, a smart sidebar that adapts to whatever you're doing online. ChatGPT's new Study Mode turns the chatbot into a personalized tutor.

articles.title: A report on what I didn't do
articles.author: BROOKE GREENBERG
articles.summary: AI-generated summaries or "answers" are intrusive and often wrong. The El Dorado Female Academy in Arkansas was established in 1848. Its founders were Misses Brooke, who taught at Spring Hill, Arkansas. AI is a technology that generates text based on what word or phrase is statistically most likely to come next.

articles.title: New AI rules come into force in EU
articles.author: RTE
articles.summary: New rules came into force yesterday requiring makers of artificial intelligence (AI) models to ensure their systems are safe and transparent. The latest phase of the EU's AI Act also means the Government must put structures in place to prevent the development of artificial voices that can convince you that they are human.

articles.title: The AI revolution is here to make you stupid
articles.author: The Daily Telegraph
articles.summary: "When you have [the job] automated, you don't really start to contemplate the deep origin of things".       .   "When you've got the job, you can't think about the origins of things."  "You don't start to think about anything.

articles.title: One Tech Tip: Get the most out of ChatGPT and other AI chatbots with better prompts
articles.summary: Chatbots such as OpenAI's ChatGPT, Google's Gemini and Anthropic's Claude have become hugely popular and embedded into daily life for many users. They're powerful tools that can help us with so many different tasks. If you're getting mediocre results from ChatGpt, try sharpening up your prompts.

articles.title: 🌱 Patch AM: Annual Pasta Feed features Napa wine tasting
articles.author: Patch AM Team
articles.summary: Today's Napa Patch AM is brought to you in part by T-Mobile. Friends of Loma Vista Farm are hosting their annual Pasta Feed & Auction to raise funds for farm maintenance. The event will feature a wine tasting at Robert Biale Vineyards in Napa. On board the Napa Valley Wine Train, guests enjoy exquisite dining and scenic views through California's vineyards. Board of Supervisors is debating a new resolution to regulate the ethical use of AI among county employees.

articles.title: Google AI Mode vs. Gemini: A Striking Parallels Exploration
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Gemini app unveiled at Google's I/O developer conference hints at a shift towards proactive, contextually aware AI assistance designed to integrate seamlessly into users' daily lives. Google AI Mode and Gemini share a common lineage but diverge in implementation and access. Both represent Google's push into generative AI, offering powerful tools for data processing, content creation, and task completion.

articles.title: Southeast Missourian participating in use of artificial intelligence i...
articles.author: Southeast Missourian
articles.summary: The Southeast Missourian is participating in a survey regarding the use of artificial intelligence in the news industry. Journalists use AI in several ways, including transcribing recorded interviews, developing interview questions, analyzing stories for completeness and bias and writing headlines. The company policy details how journalists may employ AI and the responsibility editors have regarding its use.

articles.title: AI Talent Demand Rivals LeBron James' Popularity
articles.author: Luis Mendoza
articles.summary: AI Talent War intensifies: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg personally intervened to secure a highly sought-after AI expert for $250 million over four years. Meta has been actively bolstering its 'Super Intelligence Labs,' aiming to recruit 50 leading AI professionals. This year alone, Meta has successfully poached 40 AI talents from major competitors, including Google, Apple, and OpenAI. Microsoft has also been actively acquiring AI expertise, recently recruiting 20 AI experts from Google DeepMind.

articles.title: Korea's AI-powered buses debut in Europe
articles.author: Korea Times
articles.summary: Korea's artificial intelligence-powered demand responsive buses will begin operations in Hungary later this month. It's the debut of Korean smart mobility technology in Europe, the Ministry of Economy and Finance and Hyundai Motor are behind it. It will be powered by AI.

articles.title: Will AI help or wreck your summer vacation?
articles.author: Catherine Thorbecke
articles.summary: On a recent trip to Taiwan, I asked ChatGPT for recommendations for the best beef noodles in my area. The chatbot recommended a place that was a short walk and featured some of the most delicious, melt-in-your-mouth beef tendon I've ever had.

articles.title: Sam Altman hypes new models, products, and features ahead of GPT-5 launch: Know what's coming
articles.author: Unnati Gusain
articles.summary: OpenAI is preparing to unveil its next generation AI model, GPT 5, this month. It will be released in three versions: flagship, a smaller "mini" version and an ultracompact "nano" version. The primary and mini models will be integrated into ChatGPT, but the nano edition is expected to remain exclusive to API users.

articles.title: AI robot pet hit in Japan as personalities vary based on upbringing
articles.author: Manila Standard
articles.summary: A robot pet with artificial intelligence has been created. It has a fluffy robot pet equipped with artificial limbs. It's called a "Robot Pet". It's a robot with artificial legs and a head with artificial features. It can be controlled by a remote control.

articles.title: Bill Gates says: AI today can replace human work, the most complex coding tasks, but it is not …
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Bill Gates believes that artificial intelligence (AI) is not capable enough to handle the most complex coding tasks yet. He believes that AI can replace humans in simpler tasks, but not in more complex ones yet.    .   for more information, visit Bill Gates' blog.

articles.title: 你與 ChatGPT 的對話竟然可 Google 得到？OpenAI：功能已撤回
articles.author: Martin Ma
articles.summary: ChatGPT, OpenAI, Goolge, Yahoo, Google, Bing and Facebook are using AI to improve their chat-based services. ChatGPT allows users to share content between other chat-enabled services.  It also allows them to share chat-related content.

articles.title: August Changes: Key Updates to Pensions, Utilities, and ID Cards
articles.summary: New EU AI regulations take effect on August 2, 2024 for generally accessible AI tools entering the market. Existing AI models have until August 2027 to adapt to the new requirements. Private pension auto-enrolment threshold for employees earning over £10,000 per year must be automatically enrolled from August 2025. State pension triple lock review is likely to result in a pension increase.

articles.title: Can we really trust AI to tell the truth?
articles.author: Guest Columnist
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is the latest unstoppable technology to revolutionise our lives. The government's technology secretary was reported to have held multiple meetings with tech sector employees earlier this year. Government has come to the decision that it is pro-AI, specifically, pro-ai assistants.

articles.title: The AI Oracle: Echoes of the Soul
articles.author: Omar El Sayed
articles.summary: The advent of Artificial Intelligence prompts a re-evaluation of humanity's place in the universe. It's not an existential threat, but a powerful mirror reflecting a familiar version of ourselves. AI has the potential to alleviate the burden of repetitive tasks, freeing us from the tyranny of accumulating knowledge. It allows us to engage with purpose and meaning.

articles.title: ChatGPT's Predictions: Top Side Hustles to Pursue in 2025
articles.summary: ChatGPT predicts the top side hustles to pursue in the coming year. AI-powered product description optimization is a high-demand service. The role of the virtual assistant is evolving and AI integration specialists will be highly sought after in the future. Data analysis offers a compelling side hustle prospect.

articles.title: APEC Economies Advance AI Standards for Trust and Innovation (APEC - Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence (AI) reshapes economies and societies across the Asia-Pacific, APEC is stepping up efforts to ensure this transformation is safe, inclusive and sustainable. More than 200 policymakers, technologists and standards experts convened in Incheon for the APEC AI Standards Conference.

articles.title: AI robot pet with unique personalities hit in Japan
articles.author: Anadolu Agency
articles.summary: Moflin robot is popular in Japan. Moflin can exhibit more than 4 million distinct personality traits and identifies the person who interacts with it. People can feel that their Moflins are different from other robots, as the robots display individual personalities and emotions.

articles.title: UAE: 10-year-old Emirati girl builds AI academy for kids, aims to bridge gender gap
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: A 10-year-old Emirati has launched an AI (artificial intelligence) academy for children aged 7 to 13. The academy aims to boost global digital literacy. The Emirati didn't want his lessons to sound too formal, because he wanted them to be fun.

articles.title: Saint, Satan, Sam: Chat about the ChatGPT Man
articles.author: Indian Express
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI chatbot created by Sam Altman and OpenAI. Read it here: ChatGPT, OpenAI’s groundbreaking AI chat bot, made Altman a global success.    - Read it now: chatGPT.

articles.title: These Are The Jobs Microsoft Says Will Be Replaced By AI
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: According to Microsoft, these are the jobs that are going to be replaced by artificial intelligence in the months and years to come, and they are the ones that are most likely to be lost to technology. It is not yet clear what the future of these jobs will be.

articles.title: The clanker of clankers: Get every major AI model for 85% off
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: Lifetime access to GPT-4o, Claude 3, Gemini Pro and more in one platform is $79.97 (MSRP $540). For writing, editing, designing, researching and automating, you don't need a single bot.

articles.title: Why tomorrow's best devs won't just code — they'll curate, coordinate and command AI
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: AI coding requires a serious structural change. Where does that leave entry-level developers and the software industry as a whole? Read more at: http://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-become-a-software-developer-in-the-automated-coding-industry.

articles.title: UAE secures top spot in global AI talent rankings
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: The UAE has 0.7% of the global AI talent pool and is ranked among the world's top 20 for artificial intelligence (AI) talent density, alongside Saudi Arabia in the latest Global AI Competitiveness Index published by the International Finance Forum (IFF) and Deep Knowledge Group.

articles.title: AI Models Spark Controversy: Unveiling the Future of the Fashion Industry
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is sending ripples through creative industries. A Vogue AI ad featuring a computer-generated model has ignited a conversation about the rise of AI models and what it means for human beings.       in this context, the recent stir caused by the Vogue ad has ignited the conversation.

articles.title: AI-Driven Cyber Defence Takes Centre Stage in New Era
articles.author: The Arabian Post
articles.summary: The world of cybersecurity has entered an uncharted realm where artificial intelligence is not only a weapon for cyber attackers but also a critical tool in defending against these increasingly sophisticated threats. As cybercriminals turn to AI to power their attacks, the race is on to develop AI.

articles.title: Wisconsin leaders oblivious to issues driving AI, energy and climate change
articles.author: Herald Times Reporter
articles.summary: Zuckerberg wants to build several massive AI data centers for superintelligence. He is intensifying his pursuit of a technology he has chased with a talent war for top engineers. He wants to spend hundreds of billions of dollars on AI data centres.

articles.title: Who is Matt Deitke? The 24-year-old AI researcher and PhD dropout behind Meta's $250 million offer
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: In an era where artificial intelligence is redrawing the boundaries of human capability, the competition to secure the brightest minds has intensified into an all-out global race. Amidst billion-dollar investments, multimodal breakthroughs, and the relentless pursuit of artificial general intelligence, one name has emerged: Google.

articles.title: Race for AI, quantum in attempt to create future of science, tech over upcoming two decade
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: The competition to lead in artificial intelligence (AI) and quantum technology will play a crucial role in shaping the future of global science and technology over the next two decades, according to Menafn. Menafna is a news agency based in Meneraf.

articles.title: These Are the Photoshop AI Tools Worth Using: How I Use AI to Edit My Photos
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: I put Photoshop's AI tools to the test. Here are my tips on how to use generative fill, remove and expand in the AI tool set.   .    i   in the tool set "Generative Fill, Remove, and expand".

articles.title: The AI 'algorithmic audit' could be coming to hotel room checkout
articles.author: system
articles.summary: AI is already influencing bills at the car rental counter. Hotel room charges and dinner check could be next. AI is influencing car rental and hotel room charges.    iReport.com: What do you think AI can influence your car rental bill?

articles.title: Your public ChatGPT queries are getting indexed by Google and other search engines
articles.author: Business Ghana
articles.summary: If you filter search results on Google, Bing, and other search engines to only include URLs from the domain 'https://chatgpt.com/share,' you can find strangers' conversations with ChatGPT. Sometimes the shared conversation links are dull and people ask for help.

articles.title: Godfather Of AI Warns Technology May Invent Its Own Language: 'It Gets Scary'
articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton, the 'godfather of AI', said that AI has already demonstrated that it can think terrible thoughts and it can be controlled by the mind. He believes that AI will be able to think any way it wants in the future.

articles.title: AI search pushing an already weakened media ecosystem to the brink
articles.author: Justin TALLIS
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence assistants like ChatGPT are cutting into traditional online search traffic, depriving news sites of visitors and impacting the advertising revenue they desperately need. The next three or four years will be challenging for publishers everywhere, warns Matt Karolian, vice president of research at Boston Globe Media.

articles.title: AI search pushing an already weakened media ecosystem to the brink
articles.author: Justin TALLIS
articles.summary: Generative artificial intelligence assistants like ChatGPT are cutting into traditional online search traffic, depriving news sites of visitors and impacting the advertising revenue they desperately need. Matt Karolian, vice president of research and development at Boston Globe Media, warned that the next three or four years will be challenging for publishers everywhere.
